Name: Cerulean Echoes Adrift in the Winds: Epilogue
Description: Learn about the Aetherfin from Shorekeeper.
QuestDesc: Learn about the Aetherfin from Shorekeeper.

Conditions.PreQuestName: Cerulean Echoes Adrift in the Winds: Part II

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Shorekeeper is staring at the Aetherfins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Aetherfins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They vanished when you left the Black Shores, and now, after 20 years, they are here again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …The past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Aetherfins vanished when you left the Black Shores, and now, after 20 years, they are here again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to you and KU-Key, they can now swim freely here, as they once did.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything's back to the way it used to be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, that's not it. I'm simply reflecting on what you said before…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "No one ever steps in the same river twice."

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wonder… is this all just a beautiful dream?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As a part of the Tethys System, I cannot assume a physical form and lack the ability to dream.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But recent events have made me question if I'm truly back in reality. Could I still be trapped inside the Necrostar's event horizon?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or perhaps I am lost in a fleeting dream at light speed, unable to awaken?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Apologies. Please excuse my strange ramblings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since that last incident, I find myself plagued by strange and erratic thoughts from time to time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that so? You've said this before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that so? Perhaps I need more time to fully grasp the nature of these.... emotions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Again, thank you for saving the Aetherfins. These gentle beings are reminiscent of those Black Shores members who once filled these halls.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their presence reminds me of so many familiar faces… They never truly left us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}? Is something wrong?

Options.PlotLineKey: Ask about the pictures mentioned by KU-Key.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I apologize. I didn't intend to monitor you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's just that... I found it difficult not to be attentive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When KU-Key was unable to open the portal in time, I stepped in instinctively.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Am I... troubling you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? I'm glad to hear that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those pictures... they were taken in secret by the Black Shores members for your birthday party.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the end, the party was never held, because you were too busy to attend. But Hoda and the others held on to them anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't expect KU-Key to find them among the abandoned data.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Please take care.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The feeling I have when I see those pictures, the Aetherfins, and you again… It must be happiness, hmm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wherever you are, please know that I'm always here to support you.
